com.simsilica.ethereal.zone

Class ZoneManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.simsilica.ethereal.zone.ZoneManager

  • public class ZoneManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages all of the zones for all of the players. This is used to update the status of active objects. The zone manager then makes sure that information gets to where it needs to go.

    • Method Detail

      • getGrid

        public ZoneGrid getGrid()

      • setCollectHistory

        public void setCollectHistory(boolean b)
        Set to true if history should be collected or false if object updates should be ignored. Generally, the StateCollector will turn history collection on when it is ready to start periodically purging history. Otherwise there is a risk that the buffers will overflow before the first purge is done.

      • getCollectHistory

        public boolean getCollectHistory()

      • getZoneRange

        protected ZoneManager.ZoneRange getZoneRange(java.lang.Long id,
                                 boolean create)

      • beginUpdate

        public void beginUpdate(long time)

      • updateEntity

        public void updateEntity(java.lang.Long id,
                boolean active,
                com.simsilica.mathd.Vec3d p,
                com.simsilica.mathd.Quatd orientation,
                com.simsilica.mathd.AaBBox bounds)
        Updates an entity's position in the zone space.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the object that has been moved.
        active - Currently unused. Pass 'true' or the non-sleeping state of your object if you care to be accurate for future changes.
        p - The position of the object in world space.
        orientation - The orientation of the object in world space.
        bounds - The 3D bounds of the object in WORLD SPACE. This is why it's passed every update and it allows it to change to be accurate as the object rotates and so on. But more importantly, it pushes the updating of the bounds to the thing actually controlling the position which might be able to more efficiently update it than we could internally.

      • endUpdate

        public void endUpdate()

      • purgeState

        public StateFrame[] purgeState()

      • add

        public void add(java.lang.Long id)
        Let's the zone manager know about a particular entity. This is only required if remove() if used for objects that may come back later... like for objects that enter/leave the zone manager if they are awake/asleep. Essentially it just makes sure that the object isn't pending removal on the next update.

      • remove

        public void remove(java.lang.Long id)
        Removes the entity from the zone manager. This can also be used to temporarily deactivate an entity but then add() must be called if it is active again.
